docs.lead_paragraph: Every abortion clinic in Wisconsin stopped performing abortions yesterday after a Federal judge refused to block a new state law requiring the life imprisonment of any doctor who performs a particular kind of abortion. The Wisconsin law signed last month by Gov. Tommy G. Thompson bans a controversial late-term abortion method that anti-abortion groups call ''partial-birth abortion,'' in which the fetus is partly delivered, legs first, and its brains then suctioned out so the head will pass more easily through the birth canal.

headline.main: Wisconsin Abortion Clinics Shut Down, Citing New Law

docs.abstract: Every abortion clinic in Wisconsin stops performing abortions after Federal judge refuses to block new state law requiring life imprisonment of any doctor who performs a particular kind of abortion; Wisconsin law signed last month by Gov Tommy G Thompson bans controversial late-term abortion method that anti-abortion groups call 'partial-birth abortion'; but doctors who perform abortions in Wisconsin say law is so broadly written that it could make them liable for prosecution for any abortion procedure (M)
docs.snippet: Every abortion clinic in Wisconsin stopped performing abortions yesterday after a Federal judge refused to block a new state law requiring the life imprisonment of any doctor who performs a particular kind of abortion.     The Wisconsin law signed...

docs.lead_paragraph: Mandatory testing of newborns for exposure to H.I.V., the virus that causes AIDS, raised heated opposition from civil liberties groups concerned about confidentiality. But the New York State Legislature approved infant testing because early detection can mean earlier treatment. That purpose, however, is thwarted if test results are delayed in reaching doctors caring for mothers and infants. Some doctors at Tisch Hospital at New York University Medical Center and Bellevue Hospital say that sometimes they receive notice of positive test results two weeks after an infant's birth. Under state regulations, newborns' blood samples should be taken the day after birth and shipped to the state medical laboratory. The state is supposed to notify the hospital within 72 hours of receiving the sample if the test result is positive.
docs.abstract: Editorial warns that purpose of testing newborns for AIDS virus is defeated if test results are delayed; notes importance of commencing drug treatment immediately after birth and warning mothers not to breast-feed
